channel.title: Grim's Hood
channel.description:
I got grim's hood to spawn alright, I put it on and it goes into the head spot, the only thing is, it makes my player invisible. Anyone got a solution?
Many Thanks,
Syrillia

item.title: Grim's Hood
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Stanyer, post:4, topic:159282”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=216918.msg1887989#msg1887989 date=1195590049]

I got grim’s hood to spawn alright, I put it on and it goes into the head spot, the only thing is, it makes my player invisible. Anyone got a solution?

Many Thanks,

Syrillia
[/quote]Client-side.

Most of the grim hood is client-side anyways… except for the spawning part. If you hardcoded make sure you included the right int values in class8.

Client sided lawl.

Works on my server i use silabs, also on some servers gnome scarf makes people invisible, its the server cause it works on mine too.[/quote]Yes, client-sided, you idiot. Shut up if all you know about is Silab’s ‘amazing’ client. Remember that one rule: Only post if you know what you’re talking about ?

Seriously, it’s client-sided if you want it on your own client. See, Silab edited it client-side, that’s why it works on any server. If you’re using Silab/Hax’s client then it will not work because she/he have not finished (atleast that’s true with Hax’s).

If you’re not using silab’s client and your invisible, it’s because that client does not support that model/item and is turning you invisible because it does not know what else for you to be at the time. Try using Silab’s/Hax’s client, or hardcode the grim hood model into your own.

If I’m wrong about anything of the above involving Silab’s client, then don’t blame me. I never use it, and don’t plan to use it unless I test out some server or something simlilar to that.

Read full topic

item.title: Grim's Hood
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

I’m using V4. Have been since like, forever. It still works as good, so you know.[br][size=1]Posted on: 20-11-2007, 19:29:55[/size][hr]How would I hardcode it? I’ve just bumped these up to 13999 to allow for the item ID;

	public static boolean[] itemStackable = new boolean[13999];
	public static boolean[] itemIsNote = new boolean[13999];
	public static boolean[] itemTwoHanded = new boolean[13999];
	public static boolean[] itemTradeable = new boolean[13999];
	public static boolean[] itemSellable = new boolean[13999];

added it to the item.cfg, and spawned it. Any problems there?

many thanks,

Syrillia

Read full topic
